children.text: The auto expo debuted in 1986 at Pragati Maidan, New Delhi. Pragati maidan is a venue for large exhibitions and conventions in New Delhi.  Almost 65 countries, approx 800 participants, and 1,15000 visitors are participating in this 4 days exhibition. India is one of the most promising global automotive markets, with a 57 billion dollar auto component business that has developed at least as fast as the vehicle maker in recent years.

Exhibitors use this platform to promote their brands and develop their corporate image. Auto Expo has always attracted a large crowd of over a million people, making it not only one of the largest exhibitions in India, both in terms of space occupied and crowd size, and one of the world's major motor shows. The Auto Expo attracts participation from over 30 countries, including China, Germany, Italy, Japan, Korea, South Africa, Singapore, Sweden, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, and the United States.
1. Auto expo- components show at Pragati Maidan (12-15 January 2023)
12 January 2023- Inauguration- on invitation -10:00 am onward
12 January 2023- Media and special invitee -10:00 am to 06:00 pm
12-14 January 2023- Bussiness Visitors - 10:00 am to 06:00 pm
15 January 2023- Bussiness Visitor- 10:00 am to 01:00 pm
15 January 2023- General Visitor- 01:00 am to 05:00 pm
2. Auto expo- the motor show in India expo mart, Greater Noida (13-18 January 2023)

The Motor show includes Cars, MUVs/SUVs, two-wheeler, three-wheelers, special vehicles, commercials vehicles (trucks&busses), Vintage cars supercars, tires and tubes, Oil companies institutions, financial institutions, automotive design & technologies, etc.

Entry into the hall is restricted 30 minutes before the official closing time of 11:00 am. The entry price is 750/per person, no ticket would be required for children. you can book from BookMyShow or PAYTM.
You can easily access via the metro, bus, car, or taxi to the exhibition, the nearest metro station is Pragati Maidan metro station (1km).
If you have come from outside, you should get a home-like environment so your exhibition can be successful. there are several luxury hotels at very affordable near Pragati maidan-

Here are some interesting things you might don't know-

posts.title: Things to do in Delhi in Winter

children.text: Although the day temperature is warm in Delhi, usually winter starts in Delhi in the month of November and ends in march, the peak winter months are December and January when the temperature falls down to a single digit. if you are a traveler and want to see the city in winter then this is a great opportunity to explore the city in a cold and pleasant temperature and this is a good relief for travelers as well as the people who live here. The tourist place that is visited in Delhi is Jama Masjid, Red Fort, Raj Ghat, Humayun Tomb, Lotus Temple, Isckon Temple, India Gate, Parliament House, Qutub Minar, and many more.

posts.title: Plastindia 2023 : Everything you need to know before visit

children.text: Plastindia 2023 is an international exhibition and conference for the plastics industry, set to take place in Pragati Maidan, Delhi, from February 1-5, 2023. The event is organized every three years by the Plastindia Foundation and will feature a wide range of exhibits and displays from companies and organizations in the plastics industry, as well as a conference program with speakers and discussions. Plastindia was established in 1987 dedicated towards national growth with plastics, the foundation is to create opportunities to showcase Indian capabilities and progress.
Some key information & goals of plasindia 2023

Delhi is a perfect location for such an event as it is one of the major business hubs in India. The city has a large number of industries, including plastics, and it is also home to many research and development centers for the industry. The event is expected to have a major economic impact on the city, as it will attract a large number of visitors and businesses to the area. The event will also provide a platform for local businesses to showcase their products and services to a global audience, which will help to promote the region as a center for the plastics industry.

The event attracts a large number of attendees from around the world, including buyers, suppliers, and industry experts . The exhibits will showcase the latest technology, equipment, and materials used in the plastics industry, including machinery, raw materials, finished goods, and services. The exhibitors will have an opportunity to meet with professionals from different sectors of the industry. If you come from outside of Delhi and want to stay in luxury rooms at a very affordable price then there are many hotels near Pragati Maidan such as

The event will provide an opportunity for visitors to learn about the latest trends in the industry. The conference program will cover a wide range of topics related to the plastics industry, including new technologies, market trends, sustainability and recycling and regulatory issues. Keynote speakers and panelists will include industry experts and leaders, as well as government officials and representatives from international organizations. Plastindia 2023 will also include a number of networking opportunities, such as receptions, dinners, and other events, where attendees can connect with others in the industry and establish new business relationships.
Visitors can book their passes via filling the registration form.
Click here to book your pass

In conclusion, Plastindia 2023 is a major international event that will bring together the best and brightest in the plastics industry from around the world. With its focus on showcasing new technologies, fostering networking and business opportunities, and discussing the most pressing issues facing the industry, the event is a must-attend for anyone involved in the plastics industry. The event being held in Delhi, India is an added advantage as it will provide an opportunity for local businesses to showcase their products and services to a global audience and will also have a major economic impact on the city.

posts.title: Paharganj : Everything you need to know before visit

children.text: Paharganj is a lively neighborhood in the heart of Delhi, famous for its affordability and abundance of experiences. Whether you're looking for a

, street food, restaurants, or a wide variety of shops for both domestic and international travelers, you'll find it in Paharganj. With interconnected roads such as Sadar Bazar, Main Bazar, Connaught Palace, and Karol bagh, you can easily navigate the area and take advantage of the plentiful options of hotels, lodges, restaurants, and shops - all within close proximity. Come explore and experience for yourself the wonders of Paharganj!

Delhi is divided into two parts - Old Delhi and New Delhi. Both districts have their own main railway station - Old Delhi and New Delhi. The New Delhi Railway Station is the largest and busiest railway station in the city. It has 16 platforms, with one located at Paharganj and 16 platforms located at Ajmer Gate. It serves as a major hub for the Indian Railways, connecting the national capital to other major cities and towns of India. With its extensive network and excellent facilities, it is one of the most important railway stations in the country.

posts.title: Top 10 most visited temple in delhi
Some interesting facts about republic day you should definitely know

children.text: January 26th is a very proud day for all Indians. The Indian Republic Day parade has become very famous in every Indian home ever since live broadcasts became available on television. Speeches of the nation's leaders at the Red Fort, lively celebrations of our diversity, and displays of the Indian Armed Forces fill our hearts with patriotic pride - Indian Republic Day celebrates every religion, caste, or class. When we were children, we may understand that Republic Day is a public holiday, but now we understand the meaning of Republic Day in India.
Here are some interesting facts about the republic day
The constitution of India came into existence on January 26, 1950, at 10:18 am
We thought that Rajpath has always been the first venue of the parade right? wrong, the first parade venue was Ram Lila maidan, Red fort, and National Stadium.
You might don't even believe that approximately 35000 to 55000 security guards were deployed in this event to maintain the peace.
The first parade was inaugurated in Rajpath in 1955 and the first chief guest was Malik Ghulam Mohammed, the governor-general of Pakistan.

Total 44 chief guests were invited thought the period, no guest was invited in 1952, 1953, and 1966 whereas some countries were invited several times at once. This year 10 countries might be invited to the R-Day parade.
"Abide with me" is the favorite song of Mahatma Gandhi that why each R-Day this song is played.
Another interserting fact is that the Indian soldier marched as much faster than any other country.
Parading and marching are not easy tasks, I'm done with this I know how difficult to put your foot forward and stretch your back.
We thought that 21 guns sounded as salute right? wrong, seven guns were fired every 3 times. unbelievable! but that's true.
The most fascinating part of the event is "Flypast"
Some beautiful places in India you must visit in a lifetime

Delhi is the nation's capital and the country's culinary capital in all respects, whether it be for inexpensive street food or fine dining. India Gate, which is particularly lovely at sunset, and the Red Fort, which gives off a strong sense of history.
Best time to visit- October to March
By Train- New Delhi train station, Old Delhi train station, Anand Bihar train station, Hazrat Nizamuddin train station
Hampi is an ancient riverside town and must-see god Hanuman's birthplace at Anjaneya Hill. If you admire the architecture, you must go there.
Best time to visit- November to February
Varanasi is the holiest city in India and home to thousands of temples. It is known as Shiva's City because sitting next to a ghat while watching the sunset is so soothing to the soul.
Best time to visit- November till March
By Air- Lal bahadur Shastri airport
Due to its opulent buildings, palace, and breathtaking lakeside sunset, this location will leave you speechless if you enjoy forts and lakes.
Best time to visit- October to March
By Train- Jaipur Junction railway station

The state of Himachal Pradesh in northern India has Shimla as its capital. The winters are spectacular here; you may watch snow fall as you descend to the mall road and see the chapel in the middle of the street at night.
Best time to visit- May to June & December to January
The greatest time to visit Manali is in the early winter when the mountains are covered in snow and the road leads to the 4,000-meter-high Rohtang Pass.
Best time to visit- March to June
Goa is solely famed for its stunning beaches, and the "Caravela," Asia's only floating casino, was just unveiled in the Goa coastal waters at Panaji Harbor.
Best time to visit- Mid-Novemver to Mid-February
By Bus- Margo domestic bus station

People often visit kasol for trekking and the mountain view in kasol is amazing. This location provides a variety of hikes, but Kheerganga brings you to the stunning Parvati River and a few undiscovered settlements in the Parvati Valley.
Best time to visit- March to june
By Bus- Kasol private bus station
By Train- Does not have own railway station
If you are a follower of Lord Shiva, you must visit the cave of Amarnath Ji, which is located at Mount Amarnath and is located at a height of approximately 5,486 meters above sea level.
Best time to visit- July to September
It is located in Uttara Kannada, and there are a few beaches nearby. People used to travel here for quick getaways since the rafting is exceptional and the water sports are wonderful.
Best time to visit- October to Februuary
By Air- Does not have an airport
By Bus- Gokarna main bus station
Living root bridges, a product of local bio-engineering, are what make Cherrapunji renowned. The bridges are breathtaking to view and can support 50 people at once.
Best time to visit- October to February
By Bus- Weiloi Station Bus Stop
The Jaisalmer Fort, popularly known as Sonar Qila, is the most notable monument in the city (Golden Fort). The ideal months to visit Jaisalmer are from October through March.
Best time to visit- In winter
Four of the five tallest mountains in the world may be seen from Sandakphu, including Everest, Kanchenjunga Makalu, and Lhotse, which are covered in a continuous layer of snow.
Best time to visit- March to May
By Bus- Siliguri & Takdah Bus Stand

Darjeeling's notable features include eye-catching valleys, meandering rivers, and of course, the lush green tea gardens. the Himalayan Zoo, Tiger Hill, Rock Garden, and Batasia Loop are the major attractions of these well-known hill towns.
Best time to visit-December to january

Havelock Island, formerly known as Swaraj, is well known for having some of the most breathtaking white sand beaches in the Andaman. The typical season for tourism on this island is from October through April.
Best time to visit- October to February
Lachen is a beautiful town in Sikkim that is frequented by travelers for its scenic beauty. The best months to visit are October to June.
Best time to visit-October to June

A little town called Kumbhalgarh is located close to the city of Udaipur on the western slope of the Aravalli Hills. Only the Great Wall of China is longer than its 36 km-long wall, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Best time to visit- March to June

Spice plantations, gorgeous woods, and the varied customs of its ethnic people are what make Vythiri famous. You will behold mist-cloaked hills, rich coffee and spice plantations, waterfalls, and animal excursions.
Best time to visit- October to May
Bandipur, Karnataka is regarded as one of the best tiger reserves in India, and for good reason—the sites to see there are works of art from mother nature that are worth feasting your eyes on!
Best time to visit- March to May
This valley is most renowned for its trout fishing, trekking, adventure activities, and lovely guest houses located in nature.
Best time to visit- March to June
The Orange Festival is named after the town of Dambuk, which is located in the Lower Dibang Valley of Arunachal Pradesh and is renowned for producing some of the best oranges in the nation.

Narkanda is a popular destination for those looking to venture outside of Shimla and Rampur due to its diverse scenery and fascinating locations. Just 65 miles from Shimla, fir forests surround the village of Narkanda.
Best time to visit- April, May & June
Leh, a city in Jammu and Kashmir's Ladakh region, is famous for its pure environment, Buddhist temples, and breathtaking scenic views. It is India's best location.
Best time to visit- April to July

Tiffin Top, Snow View, and Nainital Lake are just a few of the spectacular attractions in Nainital that will make your journey unforgettable. It is the least expensive but worthwhile for a quick vacation.
Best time to visit- March to June

The stunning Jim Corbett National Park, which is situated at the foothills of the Himalayas close to the well-known hill town of Nainital, is well-known for having the highest concentration of tigers of any Indian national park.
Best time to visit- July to September

Travelers may hike or go on jeep safaris to the historic monasteries of Ki and Dhankar, the pristine Dhankar lake, and more in Kaza, which is famed for its vibrant festivals and the ruins of the ancient Sakya Tangyud Monastery.
Best time to visit- Summer season
The lush hills, plush meadows, and general mysticism of the area make it special. Numerous activities, including rock climbing, mountaineering, and paragliding, are available to tourists.
Best time to visit- Summers (March to May) Or Winter (December to February)
Tosh, which is perfectly suited for both solo and group adventures and is widely known for its hippy culture, attracts travelers from all over the world.
Best time to visit- Every season but Fbruary, April and October
A special activity for couples in Ooty is to visit Doddabetta Peak. The atmosphere at Ooty is the freshest and greenest in all of India.
Best time to visit-october to June

The natural beauty and picturesque locations have made it a favored destination for tourists across the world. Surrounded by mountain peaks, lush green valleys, glistening lakes, temples, and spectacular Mughal-era gardens, it has inspired poets through the centuries.
Best time to visit- March to August

Delhi is the nation's capital and the country's culinary capital in all respects, whether it be for inexpensive street food or fine dining. India Gate, which is particularly lovely at sunset, and the Red Fort, which gives off a strong sense of history.
Best time to visit- October to March
By Train- New Delhi train station, Old Delhi train station, Anand Bihar train station, Hazrat Nizamuddin train station
Hampi is an ancient riverside town and must-see god Hanuman's birthplace at Anjaneya Hill. If you admire the architecture, you must go there.
Best time to visit- November to February
Varanasi is the holiest city in India and home to thousands of temples. It is known as Shiva's City because sitting next to a ghat while watching the sunset is so soothing to the soul.
Best time to visit- November till March
By Air- Lal bahadur Shastri airport
Due to its opulent buildings, palace, and breathtaking lakeside sunset, this location will leave you speechless if you enjoy forts and lakes.
Best time to visit- October to March
By Train- Jaipur Junction railway station

The state of Himachal Pradesh in northern India has Shimla as its capital. The winters are spectacular here; you may watch snow fall as you descend to the mall road and see the chapel in the middle of the street at night.
Best time to visit- May to June & December to January
The greatest time to visit Manali is in the early winter when the mountains are covered in snow and the road leads to the 4,000-meter-high Rohtang Pass.
Best time to visit- March to June
Goa is solely famed for its stunning beaches, and the "Caravela," Asia's only floating casino, was just unveiled in the Goa coastal waters at Panaji Harbor.
Best time to visit- Mid-Novemver to Mid-February
By Bus- Margo domestic bus station

People often visit kasol for trekking and the mountain view in kasol is amazing. This location provides a variety of hikes, but Kheerganga brings you to the stunning Parvati River and a few undiscovered settlements in the Parvati Valley.
Best time to visit- March to june
By Bus- Kasol private bus station
By Train- Does not have own railway station
If you are a follower of Lord Shiva, you must visit the cave of Amarnath Ji, which is located at Mount Amarnath and is located at a height of approximately 5,486 meters above sea level.
Best time to visit- July to September
It is located in Uttara Kannada, and there are a few beaches nearby. People used to travel here for quick getaways since the rafting is exceptional and the water sports are wonderful.
Best time to visit- October to Februuary
By Air- Does not have an airport
By Bus- Gokarna main bus station
Living root bridges, a product of local bio-engineering, are what make Cherrapunji renowned. The bridges are breathtaking to view and can support 50 people at once.
Best time to visit- October to February
By Bus- Weiloi Station Bus Stop
The Jaisalmer Fort, popularly known as Sonar Qila, is the most notable monument in the city (Golden Fort). The ideal months to visit Jaisalmer are from October through March.
Best time to visit- In winter
Four of the five tallest mountains in the world may be seen from Sandakphu, including Everest, Kanchenjunga Makalu, and Lhotse, which are covered in a continuous layer of snow.
Best time to visit- March to May
By Bus- Siliguri & Takdah Bus Stand

Darjeeling's notable features include eye-catching valleys, meandering rivers, and of course, the lush green tea gardens. the Himalayan Zoo, Tiger Hill, Rock Garden, and Batasia Loop are the major attractions of these well-known hill towns.
Best time to visit-December to january

Havelock Island, formerly known as Swaraj, is well known for having some of the most breathtaking white sand beaches in the Andaman. The typical season for tourism on this island is from October through April.
Best time to visit- October to February
Lachen is a beautiful town in Sikkim that is frequented by travelers for its scenic beauty. The best months to visit are October to June.
Best time to visit-October to June

A little town called Kumbhalgarh is located close to the city of Udaipur on the western slope of the Aravalli Hills. Only the Great Wall of China is longer than its 36 km-long wall, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Best time to visit- March to June

Spice plantations, gorgeous woods, and the varied customs of its ethnic people are what make Vythiri famous. You will behold mist-cloaked hills, rich coffee and spice plantations, waterfalls, and animal excursions.
Best time to visit- October to May
Bandipur, Karnataka is regarded as one of the best tiger reserves in India, and for good reason—the sites to see there are works of art from mother nature that are worth feasting your eyes on!
Best time to visit- March to May
This valley is most renowned for its trout fishing, trekking, adventure activities, and lovely guest houses located in nature.
Best time to visit- March to June
The Orange Festival is named after the town of Dambuk, which is located in the Lower Dibang Valley of Arunachal Pradesh and is renowned for producing some of the best oranges in the nation.

Narkanda is a popular destination for those looking to venture outside of Shimla and Rampur due to its diverse scenery and fascinating locations. Just 65 miles from Shimla, fir forests surround the village of Narkanda.
Best time to visit- April, May & June
Leh, a city in Jammu and Kashmir's Ladakh region, is famous for its pure environment, Buddhist temples, and breathtaking scenic views. It is India's best location.
Best time to visit- April to July

Tiffin Top, Snow View, and Nainital Lake are just a few of the spectacular attractions in Nainital that will make your journey unforgettable. It is the least expensive but worthwhile for a quick vacation.
Best time to visit- March to June

The stunning Jim Corbett National Park, which is situated at the foothills of the Himalayas close to the well-known hill town of Nainital, is well-known for having the highest concentration of tigers of any Indian national park.
Best time to visit- July to September

Travelers may hike or go on jeep safaris to the historic monasteries of Ki and Dhankar, the pristine Dhankar lake, and more in Kaza, which is famed for its vibrant festivals and the ruins of the ancient Sakya Tangyud Monastery.
Best time to visit- Summer season
The lush hills, plush meadows, and general mysticism of the area make it special. Numerous activities, including rock climbing, mountaineering, and paragliding, are available to tourists.
Best time to visit- Summers (March to May) Or Winter (December to February)
Tosh, which is perfectly suited for both solo and group adventures and is widely known for its hippy culture, attracts travelers from all over the world.
Best time to visit- Every season but Fbruary, April and October
A special activity for couples in Ooty is to visit Doddabetta Peak. The atmosphere at Ooty is the freshest and greenest in all of India.
Best time to visit-october to June

The natural beauty and picturesque locations have made it a favored destination for tourists across the world. Surrounded by mountain peaks, lush green valleys, glistening lakes, temples, and spectacular Mughal-era gardens, it has inspired poets through the centuries.
Best time to visit- March to August

filteredPosts.title: Top 30 most beautiful places in India that you must visit
